January 14, 1969
Mr* Ward B* Chamberlin
Vice President
Corporation for Public Broadcasting
545 Madison Avenue, 6th floor
New York, New York
Dear Ward:
A National Public Radio System was discussed in
detail at the Suffern, New York conference sponsored
by the Ford Foundation and the Corporation for Public
Bro adc as ting.
Additional discussion was continued by a smaller group
at a meeting November 8 at WNYC, New York*
From that meeting a model was developed. While the
National Association of Educational Broadcasters ana
its National Educational Radio Division have not taken
an official position, the attached reaction to the
model seems appropriate.
It is our hope that there will be other reaction and
that additional meetings will be called* I would be
pleased to meet with appropriate officers of uPB to
discuss the model and my reaction to it*
Sincerely,
Robert A. Mott
